intro: Koanophyllon ekmanii, commonly known as the Sierra foothill dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, seed-filled capsules. Koanophyllon ekmanii is often found in California and is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
